info.title: Eventbrite API
info.description: Create, manage & promote events. Add event-management features to your site. Show the world what exciting things are happening around them.

post.description: Makes a new event, and returns an event for the specified event.

parameters.description: The name of the event. Value cannot be empty nor whitespace.

parameters.description: If the event is publicly listed and searchable. Defaults to True.

get.description: Returns an event for the specified event. Many of Eventbrite?s API use cases resolve around pulling details of a specific event within an Eventbrite account.

Returns a list of subcategory as subcategories.

Get the countries and currencies which are supported by Eventbrite for ticket payment

parameters.description: Expected methods for Country

parameters.name: currency

GET.description: Searches and returns a list of checkout_settings for the current user as the key checkout_settings.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Expected methods for Country

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Expected methods for Currency

parameters.name: checkout_methods
parameters.description: One or more optional (comma-separated) checkout methods by which to filter checkout settings

POST.description: Creates a new checkout_settings object belonging to the current user. Two common settings are Eventbrite Payment Processing ( checkout_method = “eventbrite” ) and PayPal ( checkout_method = “paypal” ). In addition to the checkout_method you must provide the country and currency proceeds from the event should be paid to.

GET.description: Get a specific checkout_settings object by ID
Gets and returns a list of checkout_settings associated with a given event by its event_id.

POST.description: Associate a single or set of checkout_settings with a given event by its event_id. This does not add more checkout settings to the event, but instead replaces all checkout settings for the event with the one(s) submitted. The JSON post body is a string list of the checkout_settings IDs you want to associate.

parameters.name: checkout_settings_ids
parameters.description: A list of IDs for checkout settings that should be linked to the event. In the format: 1234,5678,9012

GET.description: Gets and returns the payout_settings (user instrument ID) associated with a given event by its event_id.

POST.description: Associate a payout user instrument ID with a given event, or clear the association by passing a null value for the user instrument ID.

parameters.name: payout_settings.user_instrument_vault_id
parameters.description: The vault ID for the user instrument to which payouts are sent

GET.description: Returns the cross_event_discount with the specified :discount_id.

POST.description: Updates the discount with the specified :discount_id. Returns the updated cross_event_discount. The fields sent are the ones that are going to be updated, the fields that are not sent will be unchanged. The same conditions and notes for the discount creation apply.

parameters.description: IDs of tickets to limit discount to.

parameters.name: discount.quantity_available

parameters.description: Allow use from this date. A datetime represented as a string in Naive Local ISO8601 date and time format, in the timezone of the event.

parameters.description: Allow use from this number of seconds before the event starts. Greater than 59 and multiple of 60.

DELETE.description:
Deletes an event if the delete is permitted. In order for a delete to be permitted, there must be no pending or
completed orders. Returns a boolean indicating success or failure of the delete.

POST.description:
Publishes an event if it has not already been deleted. In order for publish to be permitted, the event must have all
necessary information, including a name and description, an organizer, at least one ticket, and valid payment options.
This API endpoint will return argument errors for event fields that fail to validate the publish requirements. Returns
a boolean indicating success or failure of the publish.

Unpublishes an event. In order for a free event to be unpublished, it must not have any pending or completed orders,
even if the event is in the past. In order for a paid event to be unpublished, it must not have any pending or completed
orders, unless the event has been completed and paid out. Returns a boolean indicating success or failure of the
unpublish.

Cancels an event if it has not already been deleted. In order for cancel to be permitted, there must be no pending or
completed orders. Returns a boolean indicating success or failure of the cancel.
Creates a duplicate version of the event being copied. Returns the event object for the newly created event.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the new event

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start time of the new event

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end time of the new event

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: timezone for the new event (Olson format)

GET.description: Returns a response of the aggregate sales data.

parameters.name: event_ids
parameters.description: List of public event IDs to report on

parameters.description: Event status to filter down results by (Valid choices are: all, live, or ended)

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start time of the new event

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end time of the new event

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Time period to provide aggregation for in units of the selected date_facet. For example, if date_facet=hour, then period=3 returns 3 hours worth of data from the current time in the event timezone. Day is the default choice if no date_facet.

parameters.name: filter_by
parameters.description: Optional filters for sales/attendees data formatted as: {“ticket_ids”: [1234, 5678], “currencies”: [“USD”],...}NOTE: currently only filter_by ticket_ids and one currency are supported.

parameters.description: Optional field to group data on (Valid choices are: payment_method, payment_method_application, ticket, ticket_application, currency, event_currency, reserved_section, event, event_ticket, event_application, country, city, state, source, zone, location, access_level, device_name, sales_channel_lvl_1, sales_channel_lvl_2, or sales_channel_lvl_3)

parameters.name: date_facet
parameters.description: Optional date aggregation level to return data for. Day is the default choice. Monthly aggregation is represented by the first of the month. Weekly aggregation is represented by the ending Sunday of the week, where a week is defined as Monday-Sunday. (Valid choices are: fifteen, hour, day, event_day, week, month, year, or none)

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: timezone for the new event (Olson format)

POST.description:
Updates a repeating event series parent object, and optionally also creates more event dates or updates or deletes
existing event dates in the series. In order for a series date to be deleted or updated, there must be no pending or
completed orders for that date.

DELETE.description:
Deletes a repeating event series and all of its occurrences if the delete is permitted. In order for a delete to be
permitted, there must be no pending or completed orders for any dates in the series. Returns a boolean indicating
success or failure of the delete.

POST.description:
Publishes a repeating event series and all of its occurrences that are not already canceled or deleted. Once a date is cancelled it can still be uncancelled and can be viewed by the public. A deleted date cannot be undeleted and cannot by viewed by the public. In order for
publish to be permitted, the event must have all necessary information, including a name and description, an organizer,
at least one ticket, and valid payment options. This API endpoint will return argument errors for event fi

Unpublishes a repeating event series and all of its occurrences that are not already completed, canceled, or deleted. In
order for a free series to be unpublished, it must not have any pending or completed orders for any dates, even past
dates. In order for a paid series to be unpublished, it must not have any pending or completed orders for any dates,
except that completed orders for past dates that have been completed and paid out do not prevent an unpublish. Returns
a boolean indicating succe

Cancels a repeating event series and all of its occurrences that are not already canceled or deleted. In order for
cancel to be permitted, there must be no pending or completed orders for any dates in the series. Returns a boolean
indicating success or failure of the cancel.

POST.description:
Creates more event dates or updates or deletes existing event dates in a repeating event series. In order for a series
date to be deleted or updated, there must be no pending or completed orders for that date.

get.description: This method uses our search index to find publicly listed events.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The search keywords. To run an OR search, you need this format: ???keywords=google%20OR%20multimedia???. Optional.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Event categories (comma seperated): conference, conventions, entertainment, fundraisers, meetings, other, performances, reunions, sales, seminars, social, sports, tradeshows, travel, religion, fairs, food, music, recreation. Optional.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The venue address. Optional.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The venue city. Optional.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: The venue state/province/county/territory depending on the country. 2-letter state code is required for US addresses. Optional.

parameters.name: postal_code
parameters.description: The postal/zip code of the venue. Optional.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Expected methods for Country

parameters.name: within
parameters.description: If ???within??? is set and the ???city??? or ???zipcode??? resolve to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified within radius. The sorting default will be set to ???distance???. Optional.

parameters.name: within_unit
parameters.description: If within is set, you can specify the unit to use: ???M??? for miles, or ???K??? for kilometers. By default, the API will use miles. Optional.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: If ???within??? is set you can limit your search to wgs84 coordinates (latitude, longitude). Optional.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: If ???within??? is set you can limit your search to wgs84 coordinates (latitude, longitude). Optional.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The event start date. Limit the list of results to a date range, specified by a label or by exact dates. Currently supported labels include: ???All???, ???Future???, ???Past???, ???Today???, ???Yesterday???, ???Last Week???, ???This Week???, ???Next week???, ???This Month???, ???Next Month??? and months by name, e.g. ???October???. Exact date ranges take the form ???YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD???, e.g. ???2008-04-25 2008-04-27???. Optional.

parameters.name: date_created
parameters.description: The date range the event was created, specified by a label or by exact dates. Currently supported labels include: ???All???, ???Future???, ???Past???, ???Today???, ???Yesterday???, ???Last Week???, ???This Week???, ???Next week???, ???This Month???, ???Next Month??? and months by name, e.g. ???October???. Exact date ranges take the form ???YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD???, e.g. ???2008-04-25 2008-04-27???. Optional.

parameters.name: date_modified
parameters.description: The date range the event was modified, specified by a label or by exact dates. Currently supported labels include: ???All???, ???Future???, ???Past???, ???Today???, ???Yesterday???, ???Last Week???, ???This Week???, ???Next week???, ???This Month???, ???Next Month??? and months by name, e.g. ???October???. Exact date ranges take the form ???YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD???, e.g. ???2008-04-25 2008-04-27???. Optional.

parameters.name: organizer
parameters.description: The organizer name. Optional.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: Limit the number of events returned. Maximum limit is 100 events per page. Default is 10. Optional.

parameters.name: count_only
parameters.description: Only return the total number of events (???true??? or ???false???). Default is ???false???. Optional.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Sort the list of events by ???id???, ???date???, ???name???, ???city???. The default is ???date???. Optional.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Allows for paging through the results of a query. Default is 1. Optional.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Returns events with id greater than ???since_id??? value. Default is 1. Optional.

parameters.name: tracking_link
parameters.description: The tracking link code to add to the event URLs. Optional.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The query.

get.description: This method creates a new event. It returns the ID of the newly created event.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The event title. 255 characters max.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The event description. Optional.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start time of the new event

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end time of the new event

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: timezone for the new event (Olson format)

parameters.name: privacy
parameters.description: 0 for a private event, 1 for a public event. If not provided, will default to 0. Optional.

parameters.name: personalized_url
parameters.description: The event registration URL. If you pass ???testevent???, the event will be accessible at ???http://testevent.eventbrite.com???.    This string is limited to 255 characters max. Optional.

parameters.name: venue_id
parameters.description: The event venue ID. The venue must have been previously created using /venue_new. Optional.

parameters.name: organizer_id
parameters.description: The event organizer ID. The organizer must have been previously created using /organizer_new. Optional.

parameters.name: capacity
parameters.description: The maximum number of people who can attend the event. Optional.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Expected methods for Currency

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter to active (attending), inactive (not attending), all (both) orders and all_not_deleted (active and inactive but not deleted) (Valid choices are: active, inactive, all, or all_not_deleted)

parameters.name: custom_header
parameters.description: Custom HTML header for your registration page. Optional.

parameters.name: custom_footer
parameters.description: Custom HTML footer for your registration page. Optional.

parameters.name: background_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

get.description: This method lists the events created by this user. Only public events are returned if no authentication is passed.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address to remove

parameters.name: do_not_display
parameters.description: Comma separated list without spaces. Valid options include: description, venue, logo, style, organizer, tickets. Example: "do_not_display=venue,logo,style". If you leave this field blank, it will return everything. Optional.

parameters.name: event_statuses
parameters.description: Comma separated list without spaces. Valid options include: live, started, ended. Example: "event_statuses=live,started". If you leave this field blank, it will return everything. Also note that the ???ended??? option will only return events that have ended in the last 7 days. Optional.

parameters.name: asc_or_desc
parameters.description: Valid options include ???asc??? or results in ascending order or ???desc??? or descending order based on event start_date. Defaults to asc. Optional.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

get.description: This method creates new fixed-price or donation ticket types. It returns the ID of the newly created ticket.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The Event ID of the event that this tracking beacon will fire in

parameters.name: is_donation
parameters.description: 0 for fixed-price tickets, 1 for donations. 0 will be used by default if not provided. Optional.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the new event

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The event description. Optional.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: The ticket price. Enter 0.00 for free tickets. Leave blank for a donation.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: The number of tickets available. Not required for donations.

parameters.name: start_sales
parameters.description: The date and time when ticket sales start, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., ???2007-12-31 23:59:59???). Optional.

parameters.name: end_sales
parameters.description: The date and time when ticket sales stop, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., ???2007-12-31 23:59:59???). Optional.

parameters.name: include_fee
parameters.description: 0 to add the Eventbrite service fee on top of ticket price, or 1 to include it in the ticket price. 0 will be used by default if not provided. Optional.

parameters.name: min
parameters.description: The minimum number of tickets per order. Optional.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: Limit the number of events returned. Maximum limit is 100 events per page. Default is 10. Optional.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

get.description: This method returns a list of attendees for a given event. If no authentication is passed, only publicly available attendee records will be returned.

parameters.description: The Event ID of the event that this tracking beacon will fire in

parameters.description: Limit the number of attendees returned. Default limit is 50 attendees per page if paginate selected.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Allows for paging through the results of a query. Default is 1. Optional.

parameters.name: do_not_display
parameters.description: Comma separated list without spaces. Valid options include: description, venue, logo, style, organizer, tickets. Example: "do_not_display=venue,logo,style". If you leave this field blank, it will return everything. Optional.

parameters.name: show_full_barcodes
parameters.description: If set to ???true???, it will return all barcodes associates with the attendee, plus the barcode status, device used, attendee_id, and barcode number. If left blank, it will return a comma separated list of barcodes. Optional.
